title: Nuggets fire coach Malone, also won't extend GM
content: The Nuggets, in fourth place in the West, fired coach Michael Malone and said they will not extend GM Calvin Booth's contract.

title: Colts' Smith details struggle with severe OCD
content: The Colts' Braden Smith told the Indianapolis Star he has a type of OCD that prompted him to spend 48 days in a treatment facility last year and to ultimately turn a psychedelic drug that he believes helped save him.

title: Duran told of suicide attempt to help those 'alone'
content: Red Sox outfielder Jarren Duran told of his 2022 suicide attempt to "reach those who feel alone. ... If my story can help even one person, then it was worth telling."

title: Sources: Former Irish G Miles commits to TCU
content: Guard Olivia Miles, who entered the transfer portal out of Notre Dame, has committed to TCU, sources confirmed to ESPN's Shams Charania on Tuesday.

title: M's Robles out at least 12 weeks, possibly season
content: Mariners outfielder Victor Robles has a small fracture in his left shoulder and will miss at least 12 weeks -- and potentially the entire season if he needs surgery.

title: Gamecocks land top D-I scorer Latson from portal
content: FSU guard Ta'Niya Latson, who led all D-I players in scoring, said she plans to transfer to South Carolina, where she'll join high school teammate Raven Johnson.

title: Habs sign prospect Demidov after KHL deal nixed
content: Ivan Demidov, the Canadiens' top prospect, has terminated his contract with SKA St. Petersburg of the KHL and signed an entry-level deal with Montreal, the team announced Tuesday.

title: Champions League live blog: Arsenal-Real Madrid, Bayern-Inter
content: Enjoy Tuesday's UEFA Champions League quarterfinals action as Arsenal take on Real Madrid and Bayern Munich take on Internazionale.

content: Leicester City's Jeremy Monga became the second-youngest Premier League player when he made his senior debut in Monday's 3-0 loss to Newcastle United,

content: Thibaut Courtois admitted on Monday that Real Madrid have been working on coping with Champions League opponents Arsenal's set piece threat, but said it's "a matter of time" before Mikel Arteta's team win a trophy.

title: Donald Trump Raises Tariffs On China To 104%, Effective Today: White House
content: Donald Trump has followed through on his threat of "additional 50 per cent tariffs" on China starting Wednesday. The White House announced that this will make America's new tariff on China an unprecedented 104 per cent.

title: Forged Degrees, Stolen Equipment: 'Fake' Doctor's Trail Of Deception
content: Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, alias Dr N John Kamm, a man who posed as a UK-returned cardiologist and treated dozens of patients at Damoh's Mission Hospital without a valid medical license, will be in police custody for five days.

title: Why US Is Revoking Student Visas Overnight
content: The F-1 visa, which allows foreign students to study full-time at certified schools under the Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP), comes with a set of strict conditions that must be met to maintain compliance.

title: Waqf Act Comes Into Force, Top Court To Hear Pleas Challenging It Next Week
content: A clutch of petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment bill -- passed by the parliament last week -- will be heard by the Supreme Court on April 16.

title: India's Domestic Demand Big Magnet Amid US Trade Tariffs: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday that the resilience of the economy and strength of domestic demand will continue to make India an engine of growth amid the rapidly evolving global trade landscape as a result of US tariffs.

title: "Non-Aligned Nations Like India...": JPMorgan CEO's Advice To Donald Trump
content: Jamie Dimon, chief executive officer at JPMorgan Chase & Co, has warned that the recent tariff measures announced by US President Donald Trump may spark inflation and lead to recession in the world's biggest economy.

title: Priyansh Arya Ton Lights Up IPL 2025 As PBKS Register Big Win Against CSK
content: Punjab Kings vs Chennai Super Kings Highlights, IPL 2025: Priyansh Arya smashed the fastest IPL century by an uncapped player, as PBKS beat CSK by 18 runs.

title: Gujaratis Make Electoral Debut In Canada As Punjabis Seek Re-Election
content: Gujaratis have emerged as a major bloc, even as Punjabis remain a force to be reckoned with in Canada's political sphere, as immigrants of Indian origin steadily gain ground in the North American country which will hold federal elections this month.

title: Couple Flees Sweden Eco-Retreat, Leaves Behind 158 Barrels Of Human Waste
content: A Danish chef couple, known for their environment-friendly retreat Stedsans, has reportedly fled to Guatemala amid a probe by tax authorities.

title: Prince Harry's Lawyer Cites Threats From Al-Qaeda, Media In UK Security Plea
content: A lawyer for Britain's Prince Harry on Tuesday slammed an "unjustified" decision to downgrade his police protection, telling a London court the prince had recently faced threats from paparazzi and even Al-Qaeda.

title: "Congress Going To Have Massive Organisational Reshuffle": Senior Leader
content: The Congress is going to have a "massive organisational reshuffle", AICC general secretary KC Venugopal said on Tuesday as the party's top leaders met here and vowed to embark on the "path of social justice" espoused by Sardar Patel.

title: Who Is Priyansh Arya? PBKS' Rs 3.8 Crore Buy Who Scored 39-Ball Ton vs CSK
content: Priyansh Arya took down Matheesha Pathirana by slamming 22 runs in the 13th over, completing his century in the process.

title: India, China Should Stand Together To Face US Tariffs: Chinese Official
content: India and China should stand together to overcome difficulties in the face of tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump's administration, the spokesperson of the Chinese Embassy in India said on Tuesday.

title: Marsh, Pooran Shine With Bat As LSG Beat KKR By 4 Runs In Last-Over Thriller
content: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Lucknow Super Giants Highlights, IPL 2025: KKR suffered a late batting collapse to lose their high-scoring Indian Premier League contest against LSG by a mere four runs at Eden Gardens.

title: Supreme Court’s judgment in favour of Tamil Nadu government is historic: P. Wilson
content: Explaining various aspects of the verdict, the Rajya Sabha Member says that from now, the Governors must act on any Bill only as per the aid and advice of the Chief Minister and the Cabinet. The verdict has also made it clear under what circumstances the Governor can refer a Bill to the President. When asked if there is a chance of a review petition, he says it will be faced legally if it comes up

title: Academics expect Vice-Chancellor selection process to begin
content: Currently, 12 universities, including  Madurai Kamaraj University, Anna University, and University of Madras, are without Vice-Chancellors

title: Leaders, including S. Ramadoss, welcome Supreme Court verdict on powers of Governor
content: TNCC president K. Selvaperunthagai says the Supreme Court condemned Mr. Ravi’s anti-people stance and a clear verdict has been delivered

title: In 2021, Appavu, P. Wilson demanded setting of time limit for Governors to give assent to Bills
content: At the 82nd All India Presiding Officers Conference in Shimla in November 2021, Mr. Appavu had said when Governors stalled giving assent to a Bill, they are virtually overruling the will of the people of the State

title: Appeasement politics brought Congress to power but ordinary Muslims faced neglect: PM Modi on Waqf law
content: PM Modi said the Waqf law enacted in 2013 by the Congress-led UPA government created an illusion that the Act was above the Constitution.

title: New bridge across Avalurpet railway gate in Tiruvannamalai to end motorists ordeal
content: The new bridge was a long-standing demand of residents, and it will be a great relief for the public as it will ease traffic in the town, says a motorist

title: A blend of rail and sea travel that left a lasting legacy in the history of South Asian transport
content: The Boat Mail Express linked India and Ceylon for more than half-a-century. After the Pamban Bridge was opened in February 1914, the train started running between Madras and Dhanushkodi. Ferries were operated from Dhanushkodi to Talaimannar in Ceylon, a distance of 22 miles. From Talaimannar, another train took passengers to Colombo

title: Known for their high pungency and flavour, Chettikulam small onions reach a milestone
content: Favourable soil and climatic conditions, distinct drying process, and traditional storage methods contribute to the uniqueness of the Chettikulam small onions, which recently got their unique identity recognised with the grant of the Geographical Indication tag. However, those who grow this onion variety are hobbled by price fluctuations

title: HUL and NSRCEL-IIM-B launch ‘Climate Incubation Hub’ to accelerate climate-positive innovations
content: The Climate Incubation Hub will primarily focus on start-ups working in key environmental areas such as climate, nature and plastics circularity

title: Skymet forecasts ‘normal’ monsoon for 2025
content: La Nina is weak and brief, and El Nino, which normally corrupts the monsoon, is ruled out; the second half of the season is expected to be better than the first half

title: Governor cannot change mind second time, says SC
content: “As a general rule, it is not open for the Governor to reserve the Bill for the consideration of President once it was presented before him in the second round after having been returned to the House previously as per the first proviso (of Article 200),“ says Bench

title: Telangana reiterates demand for agreed joint survey of Polavaram submergence-prone areas
content: Telangana officials submit necessary material and documentary support on its concerns at the Polavaram Project Authority meeting

title: Governors are obliged to accord primacy to the will of people, says SC
content: “The Governor must be conscious to not create roadblocks or chokehold the State legislature in order to thwart and break the will of the people for political ends,” says the top court

content: Venugopal also stressed that measures to empower the party's district unit chiefs will be rolled out soon.

content: India shipped 2,97,571 metric tonnes of frozen shrimp to the U.S. during 2023-24, followed by China which accounted for 1,48,483 MT, say MPEDA officials

content: CPI(M) and CPI have demanded an immediate roll back of the hike. The two Left parties accused the government of not passing on the benefits of falling international prices of oil and gas to the people

content: CM will head the State-level execution body which will have chapters at the district, constituency, village and ward level; registration of donors and beneficiary families for the programme is under way, officials inform Naidu at a review meeting

content: Dr. Kumarasamy Thangaraj of the Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology, Hyderabad, says the information on genetic variants associated with specific diseases can be utilised for developing low-cost diagnostic kits and for personalised medicine

content: BRS working president says he’ll reveal the details of conspiracy hatched by Congress and BJP in 2-3 days

content: He will participate in the 20th South Asia Hotel Investment Conference and Workshop, scheduled to take place at the Powai Lake in Mumbai, say officials

title: NHRC notice to States on difficulties faced by prisoners
content: Human Rights Commission took suo motu cognisance of the poor conditions in jails, especially for women inmates and their children

content: Minister praises Excise department for leadership in combating drug abuse, highlighting ‘Operation Clean Slate’ success and high conviction rates.

title: Idukki declared green district under Malinya Muktham Navakeralam
content: Minister says joint effort by local bodies, business establishments, schools, colleges and various offices helped achieve the goal of garbage-free green district tag. Erattayar wins best green grama panchayat award

title: More than a shooter: How Azzi Fudd lifted UConn to title
content: a year ago during the tournament, azzi Fudd woke up so she could rehab her right knee . she had torn her ACL during a practice two games into the 2023-24 season . in high school, when she tore her aCL the first time, gyms were closed because of the COVID-19 pandemic .

title: Texas' Johnson, projected top-5 pick, enters draft
content: "this season was a rollercoaster ride," says the freshman . he is projected to be picked no. 5 in ESPN's post-NCAA tournament mock draft . "it was the best experience I've ever had," he says .

title: 'We've got Walt': How Clayton Jr. willed Florida to a title
content: seth greenberg and Jay Williams are the 2025 national champions . he posted a simple message on twitter : "1 more" in 2023-24, his first season with the Florida Gators finished 24-12 . his biggest change was not visible that day .

title: Lil Wayne visits Bill Belichick in Chapel Hill, receives UNC football jersey
content: With spring practices in full swing around the country, the  North Carolina Tar Heels  welcomed a visitor with some serious star power over the weekend -- Lil Wayne. The famed rapper visited the Tar Heels' football facilities Saturday in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, where he met head coach Bill Belichick, among others. Two Legends.  pic.twitter.com/7gWVhunTZN Lil Wayne received a custom North Carolina football jersey, with his nickname "Tunechi" and the No. 17, a nod to his roots in New Orleans' 17th Ward. Shhh...The Fireman Coming. 🔥  pic.twitter.com/Q4DLrYlMM1 Lil Wayne is a known  Green Bay Packers   superfan , but he has also expressed support for Belichick in his new position. When the longtime  New England Patriots  coach was  officially hired by  the Tar Heels in December, the artist congratulated Belichick  on social media  -- writing "Man much respect 2da GOAT coach." "Tha Carter VI," Lil Wayne's latest studio album, is slated for release in June.

title: Tariff war: Inside Elon Musk’s personal appeal to Donald Trump - and why it failed
content: Elon Musk's efforts to persuade Donald Trump to halt new tariffs failed, despite his significant financial support and influence. Trump not only ignored Musk's pleas but escalated the situation, threatening additional tariffs on Chinese imports. This public disagreement highlights a growing rift between the business world and Trump's protectionist trade policies, raising concerns about the economic fallout.

title: India among nations ready to lower tariffs under Trump policy: US trade rep
content: Trump's Trade Representative, Jameson Greer, stated that India and other nations are considering lowering tariffs following new trade measures. Greer defended Trump's trade policies, citing the need for reciprocity and addressing the US trade deficit. He highlighted the decline in manufacturing jobs and the administration's commitment to reversing industrial decline through these trade adjustments.

title: CWC meet: '5 things Congress should do to revive party'
content: As the Congress Working Committee convenes in Ahmedabad to strategize for upcoming elections, former leader Sanjay Jha proposes a five-point action plan to revitalize the party. Jha's recommendations include forming a shadow cabinet, decentralizing the party's structure with regional vice-presidents, and creating a model state of governance to showcase the Congress's capabilities.

title: UK court junks India plea, arms dealer Bhandari now free man
content: Sanjay Bhandari, accused of tax evasion and money laundering, has won his extradition battle against the Indian government in the UK. The UK high court denied Delhi's final appeal to extradite him, citing concerns about potential human rights violations and a fair trial in India.

title: Vaniya Agrawal, who disrupted Microsoft’s event shares resignation email sent
content: Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American software engineer, resigned from Microsoft after protesting the company's alleged role in providing AI technology to Israel's military. She disrupted Microsoft's 50th-anniversary celebration, accusing the company of enabling violence in Gaza. Agrawal cited a $133 million contract with Israel's Ministry of Defense and urged employees to sign the "No Azure for Apartheid" petition before her dismissal.

title: 3 killed, 6 injured as Congress leader ploughs SUV into crowd in Jaipur
content: In Jaipur, a tragic incident unfolded on Nahargarh Road as an SUV driven by Congress official Usman Khan ran over nine people, resulting in three fatalities and six injuries. Khan, allegedly speeding at 70km/h, collided with multiple vehicles over a 500m stretch.

title: Rana loses his last ditch bid to thwart extradition to India
content: Tahawwur Rana, a key planner of the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, is being extradited to India by US authorities after his final appeal was rejected. He is expected to arrive in India soon and will be formally arrested.

title: How Apple 'flew' 5 flights of iPhones from India and China to beat Trump tariffs
content: Anticipating new tariffs imposed by the US, Apple expedited shipments of iPhones and other products from India to the US in late March. This strategic move aimed to avoid a 10% reciprocal tariff, allowing Apple to maintain current pricing temporarily.

title: Instant scholar: How Chomsky’s thesis 'Transformational Analysis' reshaped linguistics
content: 'Instant Scholar' is a Times of India initiative to make academic research accessible to a wider audience. If you are a Ph.D. scholar and would like to publish a summary of your research in this section, please share a summary and authorisation to publish it. For submission, and any question on this initiative, write to us at instantscholar@timesgroup.com

title: Meghalaya principal secy found dead in Uzbek hotel
content: Meghalaya's Principal Secretary, Syed Md A Razi, was found dead in his Uzbekistan hotel room on Monday, suspected of cardiac arrest. Razi, an IRTS officer on deputation since 2021, was in Bukhara on a personal trip. Hotel staff discovered him after he didn't respond to calls. His wife is traveling to Uzbekistan to retrieve his remains.

title: Nathan MacKinnon leads EA Sports NHL 25 Team of the Season
content: EA Sports is honoring the best players of the 2024-25 NHL season . the program looks at players' performances throughout an entire calendar year . Connor Hellebuyck stands tall among goaltenders, leading in wins, save percentage and save percentage .

title: Scottie Scheffler's success on the course starts with his work off it
content: Defending champion swung and made contact, replicating his sliding swing . he made his left foot slip and fall into the bunker while his right leg folded awkwardly beneath him . the 2024 masters will be held on saturday .

title: Waiver wire: Get these players on your roster immediately
content: we tend to lean heavily on batters who call more hitter-friendly environments their homes . Oracle Park, T-Mobile Park and Petco Park are three notables on that side of the coin . this week's most-recommended pickups for standard ESPN leagues .

title: Man held for security guard’s murder in Vaniyambadi
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the day .

title: After US, Nintendo delays Switch 2 pre-orders in Canada
content: Nintendo has paused Switch 2 pre-orders in Canada, initially scheduled for April 9, aligning with a similar delay in the US due to potential tariff impacts. The June 5 launch date remains unchanged. Retailers like Walmart Canada and GameStop have confirmed the pre-order delays.

title: IPL: Priyansh Arya's stunning ton powers Punjab Kings past Chennai Super Kings
content: Priyansh Arya's explosive century propelled Punjab Kings to a thrilling 18-run victory over Chennai Super Kings. Arya's breathtaking 103 off 42 balls, including nine sixes, lifted PBKS from a precarious position to a commanding 219/6. Despite Conway's 69 and Dhoni's late fireworks, CSK fell short, as Arya's onslaught proved decisive, snapping PBKS's losing streak.

title: 'Sardar Patel in our thoughts': How Congress is reclaiming Iron Man's legacy
content: In a symbolic move, the Congress party convened a CWC meeting at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Museum in Ahmedabad, aiming to reclaim Patel's legacy. Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the BJP-RSS for appropriating Patel's heritage, highlighting Patel's ban on the RSS and emphasizing the close relationship between Patel and Nehru. The party seeks to counter the narrative of Congress sidelining Patel.

title: Pakistan: Military, Imran Khan, Shehbaz Sharif clash amid US, diaspora influence
content: Pakistan's political arena is witnessing a fierce power struggle among the military, Imran Khan, and Shehbaz Sharif's government, further complicated by US foreign policy and the Pakistani diaspora's growing influence. Khan, alleging a US-backed conspiracy, challenges the status quo from prison, while Sharif grapples with economic woes and security threats amidst a legitimacy crisis.

title: Watch: Preity Zinta's wild celebration breaks internet after Arya ton
content: Priyansh Arya, the 24-year-old Delhi batter, blasted a stunning century for Punjab Kings against Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2025, reaching the milestone in just 39 balls. Co-owner Preity Zinta's ecstatic celebration went viral as Arya's explosive innings, built on prior success in the Delhi Premier League and Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, etched his name in IPL history.

title: New Record! MS Dhoni becomes first player to ...
content: MS Dhoni achieved another milestone in his illustrious IPL career, becoming the first wicket-keeper to complete 150 catches. The CSK veteran reached this feat during a match against Punjab Kings, solidifying his legacy as an impactful player. Despite Punjab Kings' high score, Dhoni's sharp glovework stood out, proving his continued excellence and cementing his status as one of the greatest.

title: Shah asks security agencies to work in ‘mission mode’ to make J&K terror-free
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah chaired security and development review meetings in Srinagar, reiterating the government's zero-tolerance policy against terrorism and urging coordinated efforts to eliminate it. He lauded the reduction in terror activities and emphasized the commitment to lasting peace and development in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Kayla Nicole says Travis Kelce isn't the only one who has caused her pain
content: Kayla Nicole is opening up about the emotional challenges she faced while dating high-profile men, including Travis Kelce, revealing the toxic dynamics and public scrutiny that took a toll on her. She emphasizes the importance of prioritizing self-love and setting boundaries after experiencing harsh treatment and online harassment. Now, Kayla is choosing privacy and emotional safety in her relationships.

title: Gukesh out! World champion falls in Paris Freestyle Chess prelims
content: The Freestyle Chess Grand Slam preliminary stage wrapped up in Paris. Ian Nepomniachtchi and Magnus Carlsen led with 8.5 points each. Nepomniachtchi secured the top spot via tiebreaks. Maxime Vachier-Lagrave finished third. Arjun Erigaisi and Nodirbek Abdusattorov also advanced. Hikaru Nakamura qualified after a tough endgame. Gukesh Dommaraju was eliminated. Vincent Keymer's victory secured his place.

title: Explained: How unfair are Trump’s tariffs, and what is India’s relative advantage
content: The Donald Trump administration has till now shown no inclination to blink on the implementation of the reciprocal tariffs. They have however, shown openness to negotiate with countries, and India is already working on a trade deal with the US. If no imminent relief on tariffs is on the horizon, what should the world do? What should India do to counter the impact of Trump’s reciprocal tariffs?

title: No-trust move against J&K Speaker over Waqf debate ‘gag’
content: Jammu and Kashmir's assembly witnessed turmoil for the second day as opposition parties moved a no-confidence motion against Speaker Abdul Rahim Rather over a Waqf law debate. Despite calls from his own party, National Conference, for flexibility, Rather insisted assembly rules prohibited discussion on the sub-judice matter.

title: 'Kuch bolunga toh bawal ho jayega': Rahane reignites pitch controversy
content: Kolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane expressed concerns about the Eden Gardens pitch. He noted its lack of support for spinners after a loss to Lucknow Super Giants. Rahane hinted at potential issues with 'home advantage'. KKR lost their second home game. The match saw a high-scoring affair. Rahane's strategy to bowl first did not work.

title: Is Jon Snow's 'best friend' back from extinction?
content: First, scientists dug up some old bones. Fossils, actually — real direwolf teeth and skulls buried in the earth for 13,000 to 72,000 years. These bones still had tiny fragments of DNA inside — think of DNA as the instruction manual for building a creature. Of course, ancient DNA is like a book that’s been through a shredder and then set on fire, but with a lot of tech and patience, scientists can piece together a decent draft.

title: Rani Mukerji's 'Raja Ki Aayegi Baraat' producer Salim Akhtar passes away
content: Salim Akhtar, a prominent producer of Hindi films, is no more. He produced successful films like 'Phool Aur Angaare' and 'Qayamat'. Salim Akhtar died in Mumbai on April 8. The details of his death are unknown. This news comes after the recent death of Manoj Kumar. Salim Akhtar is survived by his wife, Shama Akhtar, and son, Samad Akhtar.

title: Who is Priyansh Arya, 2nd-fastest Indian to score IPL century
content: Priyansh Arya, the 24-year-old Delhi batter, has burst onto the IPL scene with a stunning 42-ball century for Punjab Kings against Chennai Super Kings. His explosive innings, the second-fastest by an Indian in IPL history, follows a trail of impressive performances, including a blistering knock in the Delhi Premier League and a century in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

title: 'Should stand together': China invites India to fight against 'US tariff abuse'
content: China urges India to unite against the US's tariff abuse, emphasizing the need for multilateralism and opposing protectionism. Despite trade tensions and Trump's threat of increased tariffs, China defends its economic system and commitment to global trade. China also hinted retaliatory measures against the US to protect its interests amid escalating trade disputes.

title: Tariff war: Trump escalates, Xi digs in — who will blink first?
content: As trade tensions escalate, President Xi Jinping adopts a confrontational stance against US tariffs, signaling readiness for a prolonged trade war. Beijing retaliates with duties and prepares for economic resilience, while Trump aims to address the trade deficit and appeal to voters. The global markets face turmoil, and analysts warn of potential economic fallout.

title: Sachin Tendulkar visits Kaziranga National Park - Watch
content: Sachin Tendulkar, the 'God of Cricket', recently visited Assam's Kaziranga National Park, enjoying a jeep safari and interacting with a young fan. His illustrious career, spanning from 1989 to 2013, includes a record-breaking 34,357 international runs and 100 centuries. A key player in India's 2011 World Cup victory, Tendulkar also led the Mumbai Indians to an IPL title in 2013.

title: Cong leader P Chidambaram faints due to heat in Ahmedabad, rushed to hospital
content: At the Congress Working Committee meeting in Ahmedabad, P. Chidambaram fainted due to the heat at Sabarmati Ashram and was quickly hospitalized. Congress leaders nationwide convened in Gujarat, a state unconquered for 30 years, to strategize future political moves. The AICC's 84th National Convention, a first for Gujarat in 64 years, addresses key national issues, internal organization, and election preparations.

title: World's 'exceptional' heat streak lengthens into March
content: Global temperatures soared to historic highs in March, continuing an unprecedented heat streak that challenges scientific understanding. Europe experienced its hottest March ever, leading to extreme rainfall variations. The world marked its second-hottest March, sustaining record-breaking temperatures since July 2023, with scientists noting the persistent anomaly and its link to human-caused climate change.

title: Why only Salman Khan can explain Trump tariffs
content: For centuries, the West has sought to decode the universe with the rigour of Euclid and the certainty of Christ. But every so often, reality throws up a figure so fundamentally resistant to analysis, so wildly entangled in contradictions, that it defies all classical tools of understanding — and instead demands a quantum lens. Donald Trump is one such figure. Not a politician in the traditional sense, nor a businessman in any useful one, he is an event horizon of logic. A paradox with a golf handicap. And like all good paradoxes, he doesn’t need to make sense — only impact.

title: Mumbai heatwave: Road near BMC headquarters ‘melts' as temperature soars
content: Mumbai experienced a high of 36.2°C with significant humidity, leading to a road near the BMC headquarters appearing to melt. Jalgaon recorded the state's highest temperature at 42.5°C. The IMD has issued a yellow alert for Mumbai, cautioning about heat-related illnesses, especially for vulnerable populations, as dry, warm easterly winds fuel the heatwave expected to last until Wednesday.

title: Aggressive Khaleel Ahmed roars at Shreyas in animated send-off
content: Khaleel Ahmed delivered a fiery performance for Chennai Super Kings against Punjab Kings, dismissing Shreyas Iyer with a stunning delivery. Ahmed's raw, emotional celebration ignited the CSK camp after the crucial wicket. Despite an expensive first over, Khaleel bounced back, showcasing his ability to strike at key moments and bring passion to the pitch, solidifying his importance to Chennai.

title: Centre seeks urgent hearing in SC before ruling on pleas against Waqf Act
content: The Centre has filed a caveat in the Supreme Court, seeking a hearing before any ruling on petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025. Several petitions, including those from Asaduddin Owaisi and the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, contest the Act, which aims to improve waqf property management. The petitions are likely to be heard before April 15.

title: IPL 2025: Pooran's milestone mayhem helps LSG sink KKR
content: Nicholas Pooran's explosive, unbeaten 87 off 36 balls propelled Lucknow Super Giants to a thrilling four-run victory over Kolkata Knight Riders in IPL 2025. Pooran's milestone innings, reaching 2,000 IPL runs in record time, helped LSG post a formidable 238/3. Despite valiant efforts from Rahane and Rinku Singh, KKR fell just short of the target.

title: Draped in sarees, men pose as women to claim MGNREGA benefits in Karnataka
content: A scam in Malhar village, Yadgir, has been exposed where men disguised as women submitted fabricated attendance photos to fraudulently claim Rs 3 lakh in MGNREGA benefits. The deceptive scheme involved uploading images via NMMS, falsely indicating female worker participation in canal dredging work at Pujari's farm.

title: MP 'doctor' who caused death of 7 patients was drawing Rs 8 lakh monthly salary
content: N John Camm, posing as Dr. Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, was arrested for allegedly causing seven patient deaths at Damoh's Mission Hospital. He performed 13 surgeries and examined 70 patients during his two-month tenure, earning a high salary. Investigations revealed his medical registration was invalid, and he lacked proper credentials, raising concerns about hospital hiring practices and oversight.
